description:
Cyprus: "Homes for the elderly and the disabled / Caregivers, as well as 24-hour care homes for People with Disabilities, both public and private, will not accept any visitors.
Centres providing services to Disabled Adults, as well as Centres providing services to the elderly will remain in operation. However, the relatives of those receiving services in these Centres are encouraged to keep them in their homes, where possible.
Home Care Providers and Home Care Services will continue to provide services to clients, provided the necessary precautionary measures announced by the Ministry of Health are taken.
• State-run kindergartens continue to be suspended, nationwide.
• Nursery schools and child day care and child supervision centres, operated either by private or
non-governmental organizations, continue to be suspended, nationwide."

description: Cyprus, April 23 to be implemented April 27: The outpatient clinics of public and private hospitals are reopening on Monday, 27 April 2020, according to a decree issued by the Minister of Health, which has been published in the Official Gazette of the Republic on 23 April.A provision according to which visits to private and public hospitals for non-urgent cases were banned, has been removed from the decree. Consequently, clinics/departments will be allowed to arrange appointments for cases that are not urgent.It is also clarified that, according to the decree, planned surgeries are cancelled for patients whose health condition allows it and their lives are not in danger.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
Cyprus, April 23 to be implemented April 27: The outpatient clinics of public and private hospitals are reopening on Monday, 27 April 2020, according to a decree issued by the Minister of Health, which has been published in the Official Gazette of the Republic on 23 April.
A provision according to which visits to private and public hospitals for non-urgent cases were banned, has been removed from the decree. Consequently, clinics/departments will be allowed to arrange appointments for cases that are not urgent.
It is also clarified that, according to the decree, planned surgeries are cancelled for patients whose health condition allows it and their lives are not in danger. UPDATE: Outpatient clinics of hospitals are allowed to reopen on April 27
date_end_spec: The policy has an unlimited time span (e.g. recommendation to wash one's hands; passing of a legal bill)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
Starting from September 14, 2020, the Ministry of Transport, Communications, and Works of Cyprus announces that:

- The student buses will carry passengers equal to 100% of the capacity of their vehicles.
- Student buses will carry a disinfection certificate against it COVID-19.
- For all students regardless of age, the use of a mask during transport is mandatory.

- in case a student of any age does not wear a protective mask will not have the right to board student buses.

- in case a student has a certificate from a doctor for exemption from the use of a mask due to medical issues, then it should be presented to the Directorate of their school which will with a relevant certificate of exemption from the use of a mask. This certificate should be presented to the bus driver whenever the student wishes to board it.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
compliance: Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Education,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description:
Starting from October 15, 2020, the Cyprus Government enforced the following: 

 The use of a protective facemask by the general population aged 12 years and above is made compulsory in all indoor areas where more than one person are present, as well as:
- In public transport
- For workers at building sites and the construction sector in general. -- - - The persons employed in the construction sector are required to use facemasks when moving by car (the number of persons in the car may not exceed two)
- Deliverers
- Elevators

Exceptions include: houses, persons actively engaged in drinking and eating, persons travelling by personal vehicle, persons in the course of sport activity/physical exercise (e.g. gyms, dance schools, etc), cooks/chefs, only during the course of cooking, persons with special cognitive abilities/mental/growing disorders who do not comply with the application of a facemask, persons with a serious neurological/myoneural disorder, which does not allow them to handle a facemask, persons with gnathofacial variations/distortions or/and injuries.

Failure to wear a face covering in any public space or on public transport is punishable by fine up to 300 euro.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Wearing Masks in all indoor spaces
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

Cypriot authorities announced new emergency measures in an effort to check the spread of the pandemic. The following measures announced that from 12 November until 30 November 2020:

description:
Cypriot authorities announced that starting from 11 December until 31 December, 2020:
- Visits to hospitals, clinics, medical and diagnostic centres, are prohibited.
- No visits are allowed to nursing homes, care for the elderly units, chronic patients’ units, homes and hostels for vulnerable groups, transitional hospitality hostels for the homeless, day centres and child protection units, with the exception of persons with disabilities whereby each tenant may receive two visits per week, with the possibility of additional visits being considered by a competent officer when an exceptional need arises.
- The entry and/or exit of any person into and from the centres for the reception, hospitality and detention of asylum seekers, is prohibited, except for the entry of new-arriving asylum seekers
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: Restrictions on visiting nursing homes/long term care facilities
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
Cypriot authorities announced that starting from 10 January until 30 January, 2021:
Private vehicles may carry persons of the same family (household), including minor children of the family, depending on the capacity of the vehicle, without the use of a mask. In the case of persons from different households, up to three (3) persons, including the driver, may ride together, with mandatory use of a mask. For movement for work purposes, in a private vehicle with a capacity of more than five (5) persons (e.g., workers on construction sites, transporters, etc.), up to four (4) persons may ride together, with mandatory use of a mask. For work purposes and if the private vehicle has a capacity of less than five (5) persons, up to three (3) persons may ride together, with mandatory use of a mask
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: Restrictions on  private vehicles in public circulation
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: National Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

Cypriot authorities announced that starting from 01 February 2021 to 14
February 2021:
- The use of protective face mask is mandatory for all persons over twelve (12) years old, indoors where there are more than one person and outdoors where there are more than two persons with the exception of the cases specified by the guidelines issued by the Ministry of Health.
-  Visits to nursing homes, care for the elderly units, chronic patients’ units, homes and hostels for vulnerable groups, transitional hospitality hostels for the homeless, day centres and child protection units are prohibited with the exception of persons with disabilities whereby each tenant may receive two visits per week with the possibility of additional visits being considered by a competent officer when an exceptional need arises.

description:
Starting from March 1, 2021, until March 15, 2021, the Cyprus Government enforced the following orders: 

The malls:  

(i) should observe the measure of 1 person minimum per 15 sqm in the whole area of the mall and to ensure that an authorized person controls the entrance of the mall so that the maximum number of customers is upheld;   

(ii) should take measures to mark the minimum distance of 2 meters, which should be observed by the customers while they are being served, both inside and outside the malls and to display at their entrance the maximum number of persons permitted in the mall under the guidelines issued by the Ministry of Health.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date

description:
Starting from March 16, 2021, until March 31, 2021, the Cyprus government enforced the following orders: 

-Visits to hospitals, clinics, medical and diagnostic centres are prohibited, save for emergencies and exceptional cases upon authorisation by the Director of the establishment.

-Visits to nursing homes, care for the elderly units, chronic patients’ units, homes and hostels for vulnerable groups, transitional hospitality hostels for the homeless, day centres and child protection units are allowed subject to the guidelines of the Ministry of Health and the Ministry of Labour, Welfare and Social Insurance.

-As of 13 March 2021 at 01:00 a.m., all public and private hospitals shall postpone all scheduled operations for non-urgent cases and admissions of patients whose medical condition allows so, and whose life is not at risk or threatened. Moreover, all consultations for non-urgent cases are cancelled
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: Restrictions on visiting nursing homes/long term care facilities
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
Cypriot Ministry of Health announced new Decree to prevent the spread of Coronavirus valid from 01 June to 30 June 2021: 

-Visits to hospitals, clinics, medical and diagnostic centres are permitted upon approval by the Manager of the institution and provided that persons aged 12 and over shall hold either a negative Covid-19 antigen rapid test performed within 72 hours, or a certificate of vaccination against Covid-19 for at least one dose and provided that three weeks have elapsed after the date of vaccination or a proof of release for those infected with Covid-19 and provided that a period of six months has not elapsed since the date of the initial positive diagnosis: 

Provided that visitors are exempted from the obligation to undergo a laboratory Covid-19 test in case of an emergency and exceptional circumstances upon
approval by the Manager of the institution.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
Cypriot Ministry of Health announced new Decree to prevent the spread of Coronavirus valid from 01 June to 30 June 2021: 

2.5 The undertakings serving the public should take the necessary measures to mark the minimum distance of 2 meters that has to be observed by the citizens, both inside and outside the premises provided that not more than 1 person per 10 sqm of working capacity may be simultaneously at the same place, i.e. the service area, including the staff. Moreover, they should display at the entrance of the premises the maximum number of persons allowed inside the premises under the guidelines issued by the Ministry of Health and the Ministry of Labour, Welfare and Social Insurance.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: Keep a distance of some other distance not listed above. Please note the distance in meters in the text entry.

description:
Cypriot Ministry of Health announced new Decree No.20 to prevent the spread of Coronavirus valid from 01 June to 30 June 2021: 

- The Ministry of Transports, Communications and Works shall issue guidelines pertaining to the transport of people by all regular buses with a fare per passenger, as well as by all public and/or private transport means:

Provided that the use of a protective facemask is mandatory for employees and passengers in all transport means mentioned in this paragraph

- 2.8 The use of protective face mask is mandatory for all persons over twelve (12) years old, indoors where there are more than one person and outdoors where there are more than two persons with the exception of the cases specified by the guidelines issued by the Ministry of Health.

description:
Cyprus government announced that as of July 17 until July 30, 2021:

- In all public and private hospitals, all scheduled surgeries for non-urgent incidents and all admissions of patients whose health condition
allows it without posing a risk or danger to human life, are postponed:
It is understood that day care clinics, outpatient visits to outpatient clinics and one-day procedures being carried out at clinics, polyclinics and private hospitals, are exempted.

- the maximum rate of bed occupancy in private hospitals is set at 70%, with the exception of beds in the Intensive Care Units, for which
the maximum rate of bed occupancy is set at 60%.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
Starting from July 20, 2021 5 am until July 31, 2021 23:59 the Cyprus Government enforced the following rules: 

Visits to hospitals, clinics, medical and diagnostic centers are permitted upon approval by the Manager of the institution and provided that persons aged 12 and above shall hold either a negative Covid-19 antigen rapid test performed within 72 hours or a certificate of vaccination against Covid-19 for at least one dose and provided that three weeks have elapsed after the date of vaccination or a proof of release for those infected with Covid-19 and provided that a period of six months has not elapsed since the date of the initial positive diagnosis: Provided that visitors are exempted from the obligation to undergo a laboratory Covid19 test in case of an emergency and exceptional circumstances upon approval by the Manager of the institution.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: Restrictions on visiting nursing homes/long term care facilities
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
Starting from July 20, 2021, until July 31, 2021, the Cyprus Government enforced: 

The use of a protective face mask is mandatory for all persons over twelve (12) years old, indoors where there are more than one person, and outdoors where there are more than two persons with the exception of the cases specified by the guidelines issued by
the Ministry of Health.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: Wearing Masks in all public spaces/everywhere
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
target_who_gen: People of a certain age (please note age range in the text entry)
compliance: Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description:
Starting from 2021-07-20 until 2021-07-27 the Cyprus Government enforced the following rule: 

The use of a face mask is compulsory in all indoor and outdoor public spaces in the Republic of Cyprus. Failure to comply with restrictions may result in a €300 fine.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: Wearing Masks in all public spaces/everywhere
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
Cyprus Ministry of Health announced a new decree valid from 30.07.2021 to 31.08.2021, which declares the following:

- Mandatory presentation of a certificate of vaccination or recovery from COVID-19 within the last 180 days or a negative result from a PCR test valid for 72 hours by all persons aged 12 years or over, including workers and visitors, for entry to nursing homes and other closed facilities.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: Restrictions on visiting nursing homes/long term care facilities
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
target_who_gen: People of a certain age (please note age range in the text entry),People who have recovered and/or survived COVID-19,People who are fully vaccinated against COVID-19,Essential workers (please note their occuption in the text entry where applicable)

description:
Starting from July 30, 2021, until August 31,  2021, the Cyprus Government endorsed the following orders:

- The presentation of the SafePass will be required in places where more than 10 people are present, including employees of the establishment/enterprise. 
- Mandatory presentation of the SafePass by all persons aged 12 years and over, including patients, visitors, and employees, for admission to the State Health Services Organization hospitals and private hospitals.
- Mandatory presentation of a certificate of vaccination or recovery from COVID-19 within the last 180 days or a negative result from a PCR test valid for 72 hours by all persons aged 12 years or over, including workers and visitors, for entry to nursing homes and other closed facilities
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: Restrictions on visiting nursing homes/long term care facilities
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Northern Cyprus has declared a curfew between 9 p.m. to 6 a.m. starting March 31. The curfew will be effective until April 10. description: On the March 5, 2020 the TRNC Authorities imposed an external border restriction. Third country nationals who will travel to the TRNC from China, Iran, Iraq, South Korea and Italy, which are considered as high risk countries in terms of COVID-19, will not be admitted to the TRNC from the land, sea and air border gates until further notice.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On the March 5, 2020 the TRNC Authorities imposed an external border restriction. Third country nationals who will travel to the TRNC from China, Iran, Iraq, South Korea and Italy, which are considered as high risk countries in terms of COVID-19, will not be admitted to the TRNC from the land, sea and air border gates until further notice. UPDATE: Originally, travellers from specific countries were denied entry (apart from TRNC citizens, their spouses and children). This entry ban got extended to third-citizens from all countries.

description: TRNC declared lockdown for 14 days starting on March 23. People who have been permitted to work (whether it be private businesses or linked to the government) are not bound by this lockdown. description: Coordinating Committee of Karpaz have put on time restrictions on essential businesses. Pharmacies, supermarkets, butchers, suppliers of livestock food and agricultural pesticides will be open between 8:00-12:00 where they will only accept orders on phone calls, and the delivery of the orders will take place between 12:00-15:00. When butchers' have sold their reserves, they will close. Bakehouses will be open for production between 20:00-08:00 and deliveries to supermarkets, grocery stores, etc. will take place between 08:00-10:00. People who have livestock can take of them between 08:00-18:00 if they live in a different district than their stockyard, and between 08.00-10:00 or 15:00-17:00 if they live in the same district. People who have greenhouses can operate between 08:00-12:00. Beekeepers can operate between 15:00-17:00. In all steps, hygiene will be the first concern.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
institution_status: This type of business  ("Shopping Centers") is allowed to open with conditions
institution_conditions: Restriction of business hours (if applicable note the hours of business in text entry)
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries
target_who_gen: Essential workers (please note their occuption in the text entry where applicable)

description: All hair and beauty salons in TRNC has to have designated entry and exit points, and the ventilation system has to be checked regularly. People working there and the customers has to wear a mask. Materials such as towels, and combs will be used only once for a person, or can be brought to the shop by the customer. Only one customer can be waiting, and the other customers cannot get service side-by side. Shaving with razors, nail and skin care, permanent make-up are not allowed. Regular sanitation of the shop and seats and tables is required.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported

description: The TRNC on March 13, 2020, is restricting all non-essential government services until March 27, 2020. All public personnel working in the public sector except for the police force, fire department, health, civil aviation, finance and similar services will be under administrative leave.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services
